intro: Elbunis alba, commonly known as the white elbunis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution, Elbunis alba is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
